   <div class="pagehero">
    <img alt="" class="pagehero-image" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/peace.jpg"/>
    <div class="pagehero-head">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="pagehero-head-inner">
       <h1 class="pagehero-title">
        Conflict resolution and stability
       </h1>
       <p class="pagehero-summary">
        Through their transformative efforts in conflict resolution, Chevening alumni are playing a vital role in building peaceful communities and promoting lasting solutions to conflict-related challenges
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <section class="section white feature-profile-outer">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="feature-profile">
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt='""' class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="1200" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square.jpg 1200w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-768x768.jpg 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-1024x1024.jpg 1024w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-400x400.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-571x571.jpg 571w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-800x800.jpg 800w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-427x427.jpg 427w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-500x500.jpg 500w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-260x260.jpg 260w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Square-430x430.jpg 430w" width="1200">
        </img>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Achaleke Christian Leke
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          National Coordinator, Local Youth Corner Cameroon
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Achaleke is a civil society activist, youth worker, and peace advocate who specialises in countering violent extremism. Over his ten year career, he has worked with over one million young people and coordinated more than 200 youth development and peacebuilding projects in Cameroon and beyond. Growing up in a community that was rife with violent extremism, Achaleke was himself a victim of radicalisation in his youth. However, he overcame many obstacles and succeeded in transforming himself from an agent of violence into an ambassador for peace and change.

Achaleke currently serves as National Coordinator of Local Youth Corner Cameroon, an organisation that champions youth action for peace. He also leads the Commonwealth Youth Peace Ambassadors Network, with responsibility for coordinating over 500 young peacebuilders across 53 countries. A prominent expert on peacebuilding, Achaleke regularly presents at high-level forums and workshops around the world. He was named Commonwealth’s Young Person of the Year in 2016.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="800" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 800px) 100vw, 800px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar.png" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar.png 800w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-300x300.png 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-150x150.png 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-768x768.png 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-40x40.png 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-400x400.png 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-250x250.png 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-571x571.png 571w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-427x427.png 427w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-320x320.png 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-500x500.png 500w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-260x260.png 260w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Oscar-430x430.png 430w" width="800"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Oscar Parra-Vera
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Magistrate at the Special Jurisdiction for Peace
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Oscar is a passionate advocate for justice in Colombia. He is committed to giving a voice to victims of armed conflict and works tirelessly to promote truth and restorative justice.
In his role as a Magistrate at the Special Jurisdiction for Peace, Oscar played a pivotal role in addressing the controversial "false positives" scandal, a series of human rights violations involving over 6,000 extrajudicial killings. Through his leadership, he helped provide truth, justice, and reparations to victims, while organising poignant acknowledgment hearings that brought together victims and perpetrators to foster dialogue, understanding, and healing. Oscar's dedication continues to inspire and effect change within the realms of human rights and peace. He is the Chevening Alumni of the Year 2024 Winner in "Human Rights"
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="587" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 592px) 100vw, 592px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey.png" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey.png 592w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-300x297.png 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-150x150.png 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-40x40.png 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-303x300.png 303w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-262x260.png 262w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Sergey-434x430.png 434w" width="592"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Sergey Sayapin
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Professor of Law, KIMEP University
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Sergey is a pioneering figure in Central Asian international criminal law, and the most cited international and criminal law scholar of his generation in Central Asia.
In 2022, he published, as the lead co-editor, a unique two-volume research handbook on international conflict and security law. He serves as sub-editor for Central Asia of the Encyclopedia of Public International Law, and his advisory work for organisations like the ICRC and UNODC underscore the significant impact he has had on legal practice. He is the Chevening Alumni of the Year 2024 Winner in "Publication".
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}
           </style>

   <div class="pagehero">
    <img alt="" class="pagehero-image" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Media-creatives.png"/>
    <div class="pagehero-head">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="pagehero-head-inner">
       <h1 class="pagehero-title">
        Art, culture, and media
       </h1>
       <p class="pagehero-summary">
        Chevening has long recognised the importance of media and the arts as channels for creative expression, storytelling, and holding power to account. Chevening Alumni are making waves across the creative industries from journalism and filmmaking, to fine art and design.
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <section class="section white feature-profile-outer">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="feature-profile">
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Jon-Momoh-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400">
        </img>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          John Momoh
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Chairman and CEO of Channels TV, Nigeria
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         John Momoh is a Nigerian broadcast journalist and the Chairman and CEO of Channels TV, a multiple award-winning television channel based in Lagos. He is widely recognized in Nigeria as a transformative industry pioneer.

After completing a Chevening Fellowship at the Thomson Foundation in Cardiff in 1990, John founded Channels TV with the aim of increasing transparency in Nigerian reporting and serving as a watchdog of government policies. The channel went on to win Nigeria’s ‘Television Station of the Year’ Award eleven times and the African Achievers Awards Trust’s 2014 ‘Best Television Station in Africa’ Award. John continues to promote values of journalistic integrity to upcoming journalists by speaking at international events, including AfricaCom 2017 and the Guardians of the Nation International Conference.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="Gisele Raulik Murphy headshot" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Gisele-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Gisele Raulik Murphy
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Partner at DUCO consultancy, Brazil
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Gisele is a consultant, researcher, lecturer, board member of the Centro Brasil Design, and founding partner of the design management consultancy DUCO.

Her studies in design and innovation inspired her to establish the first global conference and network addressing the role of design in public policy. This has contributed to several significant developments, including the integration of design into the European Commission’s Innovation Agenda. She has also obtained a PhD in design policy from the University of Wales and has worked for leading design organisations in Brazil (Centro Brasil Design) and in the UK (Design Council and Design Wales).
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="Nandita Palchoudhuri headshot" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Nandita-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Nandita Palchoudhuri
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Consultant-Curator of Indian folk art, craft, and performances
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Nandita Palchoudhuri is a social entrepreneur, curating and consulting internationally in the field of Indian folk art, craft, and performance. She designs and delivers exhibitions, installations, educational workshops, seminars, and lecture-demonstrations using Indian folk techniques and traditional practices. This process helps to regenerate the craft and provide a sustainable livelihood for the highly skilled but often unemployed artisan.

Nandita’s work is highly acclaimed. Her ‘Chandannagar Lights’ installations have been commissioned at the Thames Festival, Belfast Festival and Blackpool Illuminations Festival; and ‘Shola Craft’ featured at Edinburgh Festival. She has delivered several other craft-based presentations across the world including in France, Spain, Italy, China, and New Zealand. She also works on projects with Patachitra and UNAIDS.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="Kartini Ariffin headshot" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Kartini-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Kartini Ariffin
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Director of Dbilique Media
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Kartini is a journalist, producer, and professional speaker with more than 15 years’ experience in the media industry. For ten years, Kartini hosted 3R (Respek, Relaks, Respon), a TV show that aimed to uplift and empower young women. In 2006, she joined Media Prima as a radio announcer before being promoted to the position of Music Director in 2010. After being with the station for seven years, Kartini moved to The Cube, Celcom Bhd as the manager of Cube Radio. She then went on to become Director of Radio IM4U FM, Malaysia’s only radio station that spearheads volunteerism and encourages social activism amongst young people. Kartini is now co-founder and director of Dbilique the latest personality digital channel in Malaysia and is currently pursuing a PhD in Women Leadership in Media.

In 2017, Kartini received the McC Rising Star-Most Promising Media Leader of the Year award, and was a finalist for a UK Alumni Award in the social impact category in 2018.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="3742" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 3742px) 100vw, 3742px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot.jpg 3742w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-768x768.jpg 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-1024x1024.jpg 1024w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-400x400.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-571x571.jpg 571w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-800x800.jpg 800w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-427x427.jpg 427w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-500x500.jpg 500w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-260x260.jpg 260w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Zhao-Qi-headshot-430x430.jpg 430w" width="3742"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Zhao Qi
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Award-winning documentary filmmaker
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Zhao Qi is a Sundance and Emmy awards-winning documentary filmmaker from Beijing. His works include Last Train Home (2011 Emmy Awards), China Heavy Weight (2012 Golden Horse Award), Fallen City (2013 Sundance nomination) and The Chinese Mayor(2015 Sundance Special Jury Prize).

Zhao Qi also worked as an executive director and commissioning editor in China Central Television for 19 years. He produced over 800 documentaries covering culture, history, politics, and environment. He served as chairman of the Asia-Pacific Broadcasting Union (ABU) Prize in 2010, and was nominated executive producer to supervise the CARE project, an international co-production among over 15 Asian countries from 2012 to 2014.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>

                        $(this).attr('role', 'switch');
                        if ($(this).is(':checked')) {
                            $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are on');
                            $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'true');
                        } else {
                             $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are off');
                             $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'false');
                        }

                        $(this).parent().find('.checkbox-toggle-on').attr('aria-label',getCategoryText + ' cookies on');
                        $(this).parent().find('.checkbox-toggle-off').attr('aria-label',getCategoryText + ' cookies off');
                    });

                    $('#ccc input[type="checkbox"]').on('click', function() {

                        var getCategoryText = $(this).parent().parent().parent().find('h3').text();

                        if ($(this).is(':checked')) {
                            $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'true');
                            $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are on');
                        } else {
                            $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'false');
                            $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are off');
                        }
                    });
                }

                CookieControl.load( config );

                $(document).on('click', '#ccc-icon', function(){
                    // $('#ccc-button-holder').append('<p id="ccc-intro" style="font-size: 14px;">Accepting recommended settings turns all cookie options in the “personalise cookies”  section below to "ON".</p>');
                    $('#ccc-dismiss-button').css({"display": "inline-block", "margin-right": "10px", "margin-bottom": "5px"});
                    $('<p>You can adjust your settings at any time by returning to this menu. 				});

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}

   <div class="pagehero">
    <img alt="" class="pagehero-image" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Science-and-tech.jpg"/>
    <div class="pagehero-head">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="pagehero-head-inner">
       <h1 class="pagehero-title">
        Science, technology, innovation, and health
       </h1>
       <p class="pagehero-summary">
        Cheveners are at the forefront of scientific research and technological development to improve health outcomes and quality of life for people around the world.
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <section class="section white feature-profile-outer">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="feature-profile">
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt='""' class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Rajamanohar-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400">
        </img>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Rajamanohar Somasundaram
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          CEO, Aquaconnect; Founder, Hexolabs
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Rajamanohar is addressing global inequalities through technological innovations. His company, Hexolabs Interactive, develops grounded technological solutions for the rural masses, while his other initiative, Socialabs, advises non-profits on appropriate technology development strategies to reach out to marginalised groups. He also co-founded Aqua Connect, South Asia’s largest aqua farmers’ network, which supports aqua farming communities on sustainability goals, technology transfer, and training.

Raja’s impressive social entrepreneurship has been deservedly acclaimed: his team was named among the TR35 – TOP 20 Young Innovators in India and won ‘Social Innovator of the year 2012’ by MIT Tech Review India for the development of speech-enabled mobile solutions for the Indian market. He became a ‘TED Fellow’ in 2009 for his accomplishments in ‘Mobile4Good’ initiatives in emerging markets, and World Economic Forum recognised Raja as a ‘Young Global Leader in 2012’.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="Heesun Chung headshot" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="1999" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 2000px) 100vw, 2000px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square.png" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square.png 2000w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-150x150.png 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-300x300.png 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-768x768.png 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-1024x1024.png 1024w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-40x40.png 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-400x400.png 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-250x250.png 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-571x571.png 571w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-800x800.png 800w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-427x427.png 427w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-320x320.png 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-500x500.png 500w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-260x260.png 260w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Heesun-chung-square-430x430.png 430w" width="2000"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Heesun Chung
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Professor and Dean, Graduate School of Analytical Science and Technology, Chungnam National University
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Dr Chung is a leading forensics expert and academic. Before assuming the role of Professor and Dean at Chungnam National University, she served as the first ever female Director General of the National Forensic Service, Korea. She previously held many top forensics posts in Korea, such as Head of Department of Forensic Science, Director of Narcotics Analysis Division, and Director of Drug and Toxicology at the National Institute of Scientific Investigation.

In recognition of her outstanding work in the field of forensics, Dr Chung has been awarded a medal for distinguished service by the Korean government, a medal for the excellence in forensic science from the Mongolian government, and the most outstanding female scientist award from the Ministry of Science and Technology. In 2014, Dr Chung was made an Honorary Commander of the most Excellent Order of the British Empire (CBE), in recognition of her long-standing efforts to strengthen UK-Korea relations, particularly in the fields of science and education.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="400" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 400px) 100vw, 400px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania.jpg 400w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-150x150.jpg 150w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-300x300.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-40x40.jpg 40w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-250x250.jpg 250w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-320x320.jpg 320w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Hania-260x260.jpg 260w" width="400"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Hania Mohamed Sholkamy
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Lead researcher, Egyptian Conditional Cash Transfer (CCT) programme
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Hania is an anthropologist and feminist researcher, based at the American University in Cairo. Her research mainly explores issues of reproductive health and she has published various articles on political and social topics in Egypt and the Middle East. Hania has been a Centennial Carnegie Visiting Scholar at Yale University and a Junior Research Fellow at St. Anne’s College, University of Oxford.

She also leads the Egyptian Conditional Cash Transfer (CCT) programme, which aims to transform social protection for women in Egypt, and is one of the advisors to the United Nations Research Institute for Social Development project on human rights and social protection.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>
      <div class="feature-profile-item">
       <div class="feature-profile-image">
        <img alt="" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" decoding="async" height="446" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 548px) 100vw, 548px" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa.png" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa.png 548w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa-300x244.png 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa-49x40.png 49w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa-369x300.png 369w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa-319x260.png 319w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/Mustafa-528x430.png 528w" width="548"/>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-info">
        <div class="feature-profile-inner">
         <h3 class="feature-profile-title">
          Mustafa Özsoy
         </h3>
         <p class="feature-profile-meta job">
          Head of Growth at SMILAB
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="feature-profile-summary">
        <p>
         Mustafa is driven by a vision to revolutionise global access to dental care through his innovative startup, SMILAB. By leveraging state-of-the-art technology, SMILAB connects dentists worldwide with international experts, facilitating treatment consultations and streamlined procurement of essential medical devices. This not only improves treatment precision but also reduces treatment time, ensuring optimal patient outcomes. SMILAB has been recognised by the Istanbul Chamber of Commerce, granting them a space in their acceleration hub. Mustafa was a global finalist in StudyUK's Business and Innovation Award 2024.
        </p>
        <ul class="pagehero-meta-author-social">
        </ul>
       </div>
      </div>

                if(event.keyCode == enterKeyCode || event.keyCode == spaceKeyCode) {
                    var menuOpen = menu.checked;

                    if(menuOpen) {
                        menu.checked = false;
                    } else {
                        menu.checked = true;
                    }
                }
            });

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}
           </style>

  <main class="main clearfix" id="main">
   <div class="pagehero">
    <img alt="" class="pagehero-image" src="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/Group-of-people-1.jpg"/>
    <div class="pagehero-head">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="pagehero-head-inner">
       <h1 class="pagehero-title">
        Employers
       </h1>
       <p class="pagehero-summary">
        Everything you need to know if your staff are interested in Chevening
       </p>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="landing-content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="landing-content__noaside">
      <div class="landing-content-inner content">
       <div class="noside">
        <h3>
         What is Chevening?
        </h3>
        <p>
         Chevening is the UK government’s international leadership programme. It aims to develop global leaders across a range of professions who can use their knowledge, skills, and networks to positively change their sectors, communities, and countries.
        </p>
        <p>
         Chevening is funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO) and partner organisations and it offers two types of award – Chevening Scholarships (for one year master’s degrees) and Chevening Fellowships (for bespoke short courses).
        </p>
        <p>
         Chevening Scholarships and Fellowships are highly competitive, only 2-3% of those who apply are eventually selected, therefore, to be selected for an award is a mark of potential and of prestige.
        </p>
        <div class="wp-caption aligncenter" id="attachment_5300" style="width: 1210px">
         <img alt="Scholars at Number 10 Downing Street" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-5300" class="wp-image-5300 size-full" decoding="async" height="682" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="http://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street.jpg 1200w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-300x171.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-768x436.jpg 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-1024x582.jpg 1024w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-70x40.jpg 70w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-573x327.jpg 573w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-681x387.jpg 681w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-460x260.jpg 460w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-528x300.jpg 528w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-457x260.jpg 457w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/scholars-at-number-ten-downing-street-757x430.jpg 757w" width="1200">
          <p class="wp-caption-text" id="caption-attachment-5300">
           Chevening Scholars at Number 10 Downing Street, residence of the UK Prime Minister
          </p>
         </img>
        </div>
        <h3>
         Why would your staff be interested in a scholarship or fellowship?
        </h3>
        <p>
         Chevening offers a unique opportunity for future leaders, influencers, and decision-makers from all over the world to develop professionally and academically, network extensively, experience the UK’s culture, and build lasting positive relationships with the UK.
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          They will earn a postgraduate qualification (as scholars) or a programme completion certificate (as fellows) from a globally-recognised UK academic institution
         </li>
         <li>
          They will gain practical experience that can help enhance their careers
         </li>
         <li>
          They will broaden their horizons, and learn new ways of thinking
         </li>
         <li>
          They will expand their network, and develop contacts from the UK and all around the world
         </li>
         <li>
          They will develop interpersonal skills that will enhance their confidence, leadership ability, and critical thinking
         </li>
        </ul>
        <p>
         Chevening Scholarships and Fellowships are fully-funded, meaning that successful applicants do not pay for their courses, flights, or accommodation. After their studies in the UK, Cheveners (as we call them) are expected to return to their home countries and contribute to positive change. They become life-long members of a global community of over 50,000 leading professionals including presidents, CEOs, social entrepreneurs, academics, and creatives.
        </p>
        <div class="wp-caption aligncenter" id="attachment_5302" style="width: 1210px">
         <img alt="Alumni - Connecting tomorrows leaders" aria-describedby="caption-attachment-5302" class="size-full wp-image-5302" decoding="async" height="682" loading="lazy" sizes="(max-width: 1200px) 100vw, 1200px" src="http://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders.jpg" srcset="https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders.jpg 1200w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-300x171.jpg 300w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-768x436.jpg 768w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-1024x582.jpg 1024w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-70x40.jpg 70w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-573x327.jpg 573w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-681x387.jpg 681w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-460x260.jpg 460w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-528x300.jpg 528w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-457x260.jpg 457w, https://www.chevening.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/07/connecting-tomorrows-leaders-757x430.jpg 757w" width="1200"/>
         <p class="wp-caption-text" id="caption-attachment-5302">
          Chevening Alumni at the Summer Gala 2019
         </p>
        </div>
        <p>
         If you would like to advertise these opportunities in your organisation, please get in touch with your local British embassy, high commission, or consulate, as they may have leaflets and posters that they can supply you with.
        </p>
        <h3>
         How do employers benefit from Chevening?
        </h3>
        <p>
         The Chevening application process can take up to a year. It typically involves submitting a comprehensive application, several rounds of screening and shortlisting, an interview at the British embassy or high commission, and the submission of paperwork relating to references, university offers, visas, and English language test scores. It is truly a test of organisation, commitment, and determination.
        </p>
        <p>
         Having beaten off 98% of applicants to win an award, some successful applicants are unable to convince their employers to allow them to take the time off work to take up this once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. There are many reasons why Chevening is not only great for the applicant, it’s good news for their employers too:
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Training funded by Chevening:
          </strong>
          The cost of a master’s course worth thousands of pounds is fully-funded by Chevening. Whilst they are in the UK, Cheveners also benefit from a range of professional skills training options focused on leadership, presenting and influencing, and creative problem solving.
         </li>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Better qualified employee:
          </strong>
          Workforces want to recruit and retain the best candidates. Chevening enables employees to upskill and return with a new qualification, which could give their employers a competitive edge.
         </li>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Global contacts:
          </strong>
          With nearly 2,000 professionals from all over the world undertaking this programme every year, and a global community of over 50,000 professionals spanning every sector imaginable, who knows which contacts your employee may have easy access to through Chevening.
         </li>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Prestige:
          </strong>
          As being awarded a Chevening Scholarship or Fellowship is a huge achievement, there is a level of prestige and recognition that comes with having a Chevener working for you. We often profile the great work our alumni get up to back in their home countries, which could also result in good PR for your organisation.
         </li>
        </ul>
        <p>
         Some employers are such keen supporters of Chevening that they even fund some of scholarships, often as part of their corporate social responsibility strategy. If your organisation is interested in finding out more, please read about
         <a href="http://www.chevening.org/partner-with-us/">
          Chevening Partnerships
         </a>
         .
        </p>
        <h3>
         What happens after their time in the UK ends?
        </h3>
        <p>
         Cheveners are required to return home after their award has ended and before their UK visa expires. It is not Chevening’s intention for our scholars or fellows to remain in the UK. This mutual understanding about returning home that exists between Chevening and our scholars and fellows means that a large number of them look forward to returning to their organisations, and putting their new knowledge, skills, and networks to good use.
        </p>
       </div>

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}
           </style>

   <div class="pagehero pagehero--noimage">
    <div class="pagehero-head">
     <div class="container">
      <div class="pagehero-head-inner">
       <h1 class="pagehero-title">
        Accessibility notice
       </h1>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
   <div class="landing-content">
    <div class="container">
     <div class="landing-content__noaside">
      <div class="landing-content-inner content">
       <div class="noside">
        <h2>
         Foreign and Commonwealth Office’s Chevening website
        </h2>
        <p>
         This accessibility statement applies to
         <a href="https://www.chevening.org/">
          chevening.org/
         </a>
         website.
        </p>
        <p>
         This website is run by the Foreign and Commonwealth Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          change colours, contrast levels and fonts
         </li>
         <li>
          zoom in up to 200% without the text spilling off the screen
         </li>
         <li>
          View the browser in a one column format (1280px browser width and Zoom in to 400%)
         </li>
         <li>
          navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
         </li>
         <li>
          navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
         </li>
         <li>
          listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver
         </li>
        </ul>
        <p>
         We’ve also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
        </p>
        <h3>
         Accessibility
        </h3>
        <p>
         We know some parts of this website are not currently fully accessible:
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Non-descriptive alt text
          </strong>
          has been used on some images
         </li>
         <li>
          Content is added to the page after a search has been performed but does not inform people that use a screen reader.
         </li>
         <li>
          The contrast of
          <strong>
           non-text content
          </strong>
          did not meet the expected ratio of 1.3:1 where borders on form fields were used.
         </li>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Links
          </strong>
          are not always descriptive of their intended purpose or destination.
         </li>
         <li>
          <strong>
           Links
          </strong>
          that open in a new window do not inform users that this will happen.
         </li>
        </ul>
        <h3>
         Feedback and contact information
        </h3>
        <p>
         If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille, please email
         <a href="mailto:communications@chevening.org">
          communications@chevening.org
         </a>
         . Please put ‘Chevening.org accessibility request’ as the subject line.
        </p>
        <p>
         We’ll consider your request and get back to you in 7 days.
        </p>
        <h3>
         Reporting accessibility problems with this website
        </h3>
        <p>
         We’re always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements, please email
         <a href="mailto:communications@chevening.org">
          communications@chevening.org
         </a>
         . Please put ‘Chevening.org accessibility issue’ as the subject line.
        </p>
        <p>
         We’ll consider your request and get back to you in 7 days.
        </p>
        <h3>
         Enforcement procedure
        </h3>
        <p>
         The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
         <a href="https://www.equalityadvisoryservice.com/">
          contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
         </a>
         .
        </p>
        <h2>
         Technical information about this website’s accessibility
        </h2>
        <p>
         The Foreign Commonwealth Organisation is committed to making its websites accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
        </p>
        <h3>
         Compliance status
        </h3>
        <p>
         The Chevening website chevening.org  is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) version 2.1 AA standard, due to the non-compliances listed below.
        </p>
        <h2>
         Non-accessible content
        </h2>
        <p>
         The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
        </p>
        <h3>
         Non-compliance with the accessibility regulations
        </h3>
        <h4>
         Images
        </h4>
        <p>
         <strong>
          Non-descriptive alt text
         </strong>
         has been used on some images so people using a screen reader cannot understand the purpose of the image. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A).
        </p>
        <p>
         We plan to add meaningful text alternatives for all images by the end of September 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure our use of images meets accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h4>
         Forms
        </h4>
        <p>
         <strong>
          Buttons
         </strong>
         have been used in the mobile hamburger menu that are not labelled so screen reader users may find it difficult to determine its purpose when browsing both in and out of context. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) and 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A).
        </p>
        <p>
         We plan to make sure that all form fields are labelled and done so descriptively by the end of September 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure our use of form elements meets accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h4>
         Updating content
        </h4>
        <p>
         We work with a third party called Postgraduate Solutions to provide
         <a href="https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/find-a-course/">
          our course search tool
         </a>
         . When using this tool, content is added to the page after a search has been performed but does not inform people that use a screen reader. This means that people that use a screen reader are unaware that the search has been successful and results are displayed. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 4.1.3 Status Messages (Level AA).
        </p>
        <p>
         We are working with Postgraduate Solutions to ensure that all content that is dynamically added to the page informs people that use screen readers as soon as the search results appear and are aiming to have resolved this by December 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure updating content meets accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h4>
         Colour
        </h4>
        <p>
         We work with a third party called Postgraduate Solutions to provide
         <a href="https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/find-a-course/">
          our course search tool
         </a>
         . The contrast of
         <strong>
          non-text content
         </strong>
         within this tool did not meet the expected ratio of 1.3:1 where borders on form fields were used. This means that it may be difficult for people with low vision and/or colour deficiencies to know where to input information. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 1.4.11 Non-text Contrast (Level AA).
        </p>
        <p>
         We are working with Postgraduate Solutions to ensure that all non-text content is clearly visible by December 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure our use of colour contrast of non-text content meets the accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h4>
         Links
        </h4>
        <p>
         <strong>
          Links
         </strong>
         are not always descriptive of their intended purpose or destination. This means that people with motion impairment are unable to skip links that they are not interested in, people with cognitive limitations may be disoriented and people with visual disabilities are unable to determine the purpose of a link without leaving the link to explore its context. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 2.4.4 Link Purpose – in context (Level A) and 2.4.9 Link Purpose – Link Only – (Level AAA).
        </p>
        <p>
         We plan to ensure that all links are descriptive of their purpose and destination both in and out of the context of the page content by the end of September 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure that links are descriptive and meet the accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <p>
         Some
         <strong>
          links
         </strong>
         that open in a new window do not inform users that this will happen. This means that people can be disorientated when the new window appears. This fails WCAG 2.1 success criterion 3.2.5 Change on Request (Level AAA).
        </p>
        <p>
         We plan to ensure that all links that result in a new window opening inform people prior to selecting by the end of September 2021. When we publish new content, we will make sure that links inform people that a new window will open prior to selecting to meet the accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h2>
         Content that’s not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
        </h2>
        <h4>
         PDFs and other documents
        </h4>
        <p>
         Some of our PDFs and Word documents are essential to providing our services. For example, we have PDFs with information on how users can access our services, and forms published as Word documents. By September 2020, we plan to either fix these or replace them with accessible HTML pages. The accessibility regulations do not require us to fix PDFs or other documents published before 23 September 2018 if they’re not essential to providing our services. For example, we do not plan to fix our Impact Report from 2018.
        </p>
        <p>
         Any new PDFs or Word documents we publish will meet accessibility standards.
        </p>
        <h2>
         Preparation of this accessibility statement
        </h2>
        <p>
         This statement was prepared on 22 September 2020. It was last reviewed on 3 August 2021.
        </p>
        <p>
         This website was first tested on 16 April 2020. It was subsequently retested in February 2021 and most recently on 3 August 2021. The test and retests were carried out by The Digital Accessibility Centre and covered the following journeys, which are representative of the main templates used on the website.
        </p>
        <p>
         Website:
         <a href="http://www.chevening.org/">
          www.chevening.org
         </a>
        </p>

                function cookieStartup() {
                    $('.ccc-content--no-outline').removeClass('ccc-content--no-outline');

                        $(this).parent().find('.checkbox-toggle-off').attr('aria-label',getCategoryText + ' cookies off');

                    $('#ccc input[type="checkbox"]').on('click', function() {

                        var getCategoryText = $(this).parent().parent().parent().find('h3').text();

                        if ($(this).is(':checked')) {
                            $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'true');
                            $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are on');
                        } else {
                            $(this).attr('aria-checked', 'false');
                            $(this).parent().attr('aria-label', getCategoryText + ' are off');
                        }
                    });
                }

                CookieControl.load( config );

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}
           </style>

     <div class="feed-inner">
      <form action="/faqs/" class="filter-std" method="get">
       <div class="filter-block filter-block--input">
        <label for="faqs-choice">

        <input class="filter-field" id="faqs-choice" list="faqs-titles" name="chevening_faq" value="">
         <datalist id="faqs-titles">
          <option value="How do I access my Chevening application if I have lost/mislaid the registration email from the online application system?">

        <header class="feed-item-header">
         <h3 class="feed-item-header-title">
          <a href="https://www.chevening.org/faqs/ive-lost-my-unique-access-code-how-can-i-recover-it/">
           I’ve lost my unique access code. How can I recover it?
          </a>
         </h3>
        </header>
        <div class="feed-item-summary">
         <p>

         </p>

      <article class="feed-item">
       <div class="feed-item-info">
        <header class="feed-item-header">
         <h3 class="feed-item-header-title">
          <a href="https://www.chevening.org/faqs/can-i-save-my-application-and-come-back-to-it-later/">
           Can I save my application and come back to it later?
          </a>
         </h3>
        </header>
        <div class="feed-item-summary">
         <p>
          Yes. You can save your application and return to it as many times as you like during the application period. Just remember to click ‘save’ on each page before logging out. You can access your application using your email address and your unique access code.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </article>

        </header>
        <div class="feed-item-summary">
         <p>
          No documents are required to be uploaded in order to submit an application for Chevening. In the subsequent stages of the process, applicants who are selected for interview will be required to upload documents. You will have the opportunity to confirm the correct documents have been uploaded prior to submitting.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </article>
      <article class="feed-item">
       <div class="feed-item-info">
        <header class="feed-item-header">
         <h3 class="feed-item-header-title">
          <a href="https://www.chevening.org/faqs/can-i-withdraw-my-application/">
           Can I withdraw my application?
          </a>
         </h3>
        </header>
        <div class="feed-item-summary">
         <p>
          Yes. You can withdraw your application at any time. Please note that withdrawing your application will remove all your details from the system. You will have to re-enter all your information in order to submit.
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </article>
      <article class="feed-item">
       <div class="feed-item-info">
        <header class="feed-item-header">
         <h3 class="feed-item-header-title">
          <a href="https://www.chevening.org/faqs/can-i-use-ai-to-help-me-write-my-application/">
           Can I use artificial intelligence/ChatGPT to help me write my application?
          </a>
         </h3>
        </header>
        <div class="feed-item-summary">
         <p>
          Using artificial intelligence software to generate answers to Chevening’s essay questions is strictly prohibited. Applicants must submit their own original work. You must not use someone else’s work or present content generated by AI tools like ChatGPT as your own. Doing so violates Chevening’s guidelines on plagiarism and fraud. If your application is found to […]
         </p>
        </div>
       </div>
      </article>

           <style>
            /* If there is a fixed header */
			.header {
				position: relative;
				top: auto;
			}
			.main {
				padding: 0;
			}

			/* Alert banner styling */
			.alert-banner {
				display: none;
				background-color: #003F72;
				color: #FFFFFF;
				left: 0;
				margin-top: 0;
				padding: 2rem 1rem 0.8rem;
				position: relative;
				text-align: center;
				top: 0;
				width: 100%;
			}
			.alert-banner * {
				margin-top: 0;
			}
			.alert-banner.lightblue {
				background-color: #84A2BD;
			}
			.alert-banner.red {
				background-color: #DC0A2C;
			}
			.alert-banner.gray {
				background-color: #D0D2CF;
				color: #000000;
			}

			.alert-banner h3 {
				font-size: 1.2em;
				padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
			}
			.alert-banner p {
				margin: 0 auto;
				padding: 0;
				width: 90%;
			}
			.alert-banner p a {
				font-weight: bold;
				text-decoration: underline;
			}
			.close-icon {
				border: solid 2px #FFFFFF;
				color: #FFF;
				border-radius: 100%;
				display: block;
				font-family: sans-serif;
				font-weight: normal;
				font-size: 17px;
				height: 30px;
				margin: 1rem auto;
				text-align: center;
				width: 30px;
				line-height: 28px;
			}

			@media screen and (min-width: 960px) {
				.alert-banner {
					padding: 0.8rem 1rem;
				}
				.alert-banner p {
					padding: 0 2.5rem;
					width: 70%;
				}
				.close-icon {
					margin: 0;
					position: absolute;
					right: 2rem;
					top: 50%;
					transform: translate(0, -50%);
				}
			}

      <div class="landing-content-inner content">
       <h3>
        <strong>
         Information for Chevening applicants
        </strong>
       </h3>
       <p>
        Please read the information below before submitting your query.
       </p>
       <p>
        <strong>
         Applications for 2025-26 Chevening Scholarships are now closed.
        </strong>
       </p>
       <p>
        Due to the high volume of applications,
        <strong>
         we are unable to provide individual feedback
        </strong>
        for unsuccessful applications. We encourage you to apply again next year and to review
        <a href="https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/guidance/common-errors/">
         common application errors
        </a>
        to increase your chances of success.
       </p>
       <p>
        For details on the next steps in the application process, please refer to the
        <a href="https://www.chevening.org/scholarships/application-timeline/">
         application timeline
        </a>
        .
       </p>
       <p>
        If you have been selected for interview, you will be sent a unique link to login to the online application system to book your interview slot. To login, you’ll need the unique access code you were given when you first registered for an account. If you have lost this code, you can request a reset code from the page where you’re asked to input your unique access code. A new code will be sent to your mobile number.
       </p>
       <p>
        If you have been invited to interview and you no longer have access to the mobile number you registered with us, please complete the form below, identifying yourself as an applicant who has been invited to interview.
       </p>
       <p>
        <strong>
         Chevening Fellowships
        </strong>
       </p>
       <p>
        If you are interested in applying for a fellowship, please note that eligibility criteria and application deadlines vary. Please visit our
        <a href="https://www.chevening.org/fellowships/">
         fellowships page
        </a>
        for further details about our fellowships programmes, and your
        <a href="https://www.chevening.org/apply/?country=&award_type=">
         country page
        </a>
        to find a full list of available awards.
       </p>
       <p>
        <strong>
         Still can’t find what you’re looking for?
        </strong>
       </p>
       <p>
        If you cannot find the answer to your question on our website, please complete the form below. Due to the volume of enquiries we receive, we cannot respond to
        <a href="https://www.chevening.org/faqs/?chevening_audience=applicants">
         commonly asked questions individually
        </a>
        . If the answer to your question is available on our website, we will not be able to provide a response.
       </p>
       <h3>
        Submitting your query
       </h3>
